definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to expose/to reveal/to lay bare/also pr. [pu4 lu4]
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to break out (of disease etc)/to suddenly get rich (or prominent)

sentences.english: The previously known most distant object was a short-lived gamma ray burst.
sentences.chinese: 之前所知最遥远的天体是一次短期的伽玛射线暴。

sentences.english: Achieved Vicious Gladiator title. Achieved Ruthle Gladiator title.
sentences.chinese: 获得头衔“暴蓝田墨玉怒角斗士”。

sentences.english: The control of sandstorm will involve a lot of work and money.
sentences.chinese: 控制沙城暴需要大量的工作和资金。
达里奥有着五百人的暴鸦团。

sentences.english: After that, spam Scorpions and change to Avatars and Stealth Tanks when teched up.
sentences.chinese: 在这之后，暴蝎子并在攀科技后转型到圣灵与隐坦。

sentences.english: This thesis is concentrated on the temporal variability analysis of the prompt emission of the GRBs.
sentences.chinese: 本论文的研究集中于伽马暴本身辐射的时变分析。

sentences.english: At noon sharp the sun too soft asphalt road are all the.
sentences.chinese: 中午暴日晒得柏油马路都软绵绵的。

sentences.english: The Great Red Spot, a storm in Jupiter's atmosphere, is at least 300 years old.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的红斑，是木星上大气层的暴，的历史。

sentences.english: We shall never allow that torch of freedom to be blown out, however high the wind or stormy the tempest.
sentences.chinese: 无论多么风狂雨暴，我们绝不让自由的火炬熄灭。

sentences.english: You're just a young, hot fool .
sentences.chinese: 你不过是一个少不更事，脾气暴的傻瓜而已。

sentences.english: Obama and Hillary Dance in High School Musical 3!
sentences.chinese: 歌舞青春3之奥巴马与希拉里版，暴搞笑。

sentences.english: Zarqawi was called the "mastermind" of the insurgency in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 扎卡维被称作是伊拉克暴军中的“智多星”。

sentences.english: Jogging becomes a sort of penance for our sins of gluttony, greed, and waste.
sentences.chinese: 慢跑成了我们对自己的暴殄，贪婪，以及浪费的赎罪。

sentences.english: Why are you always so short and impatient?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么是这么暴和没有耐心？

definition: to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
